bio:
It all started when Philipp was 13 and his mom gave him a book about C++. He immediately fell in love with coding. Over the years he got to try many awesome fields like Desktop development, game dev and backend development. 
However, he found what he really enjoyed when he started with native Android development in 2019. The fact that you could build something out of nothing you always have in your pocket just felt amazing for him. 
To also help others on his journey, Philipp started to share Android content on Instagram. That content was well received and his page started gaining momentum. More and more people wanted him to start a YouTube channel as well, which he also did 2 months after starting posting on Instagram. 
Today, with roughly 6,000,000 views on YouTube (https://youtube.com/c/PhilippLackner), Philipp is one of the biggest active native Android YouTubers and is helping the Android community with regular easy-to-understand videos. On his Instagram pages @pl.coding (https://www.instagram.com/pl.coding) and @_philipplackner_ (https://www.instagram.com/_philipplackner_,) he built a combined following of around 100,000 mobile developers from around the globe.

sessions.name: Crash-reporting taken to next-level

bio: Tarika Chawla is a Senior Mobile Application Security Engineer at Shopify. She has five years of extensive experience in native mobile development and release management. She has given talks on multiple Android and iOS development. She co-organized an iOS meetup group “Philly Cocoaheads” for two years. Currently, she is leading some of the security initiatives in Mobile Security, React native at Shopify. Her work includes pairing up with different mobile teams at Shopify and implementing security features in the apps, providing security perspective for new features and initiatives. Her position helps to make sure the apps are secure for their merchants to use.
tagLine: Shopify - Senior Mobile Application Security Engineer

sessions.name: Security First Android Apps

bio: Terence is a Developer Relations engineer at Google. His primary focus is to help developers build privacy-focused apps on Android. Before joining Google, he was a software engineer on Microsoft Azure. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science from the University of Southern California. Outside of work he enjoys traveling and cooking up a storm.

sessions.name: Live Coding Session: How do you Build More Privacy Focused Apps?
Green Tech Development & Social Responsibility

bio: Thomas fell in love with Android in 2009. Since then he has been constantly contributing to the community. Thomas loves writing articles and books about mobile computing. You can frequently watch him speaking at conferences and meetups. Thomas' first encounter with programming was in the era of home computers during the early 1980s. Later came C, Perl and a few more. During the 90s he wrote a bunch of programs for the Atari ST series. The first decade of Thomas' professional career was Java. Today it’s mostly Kotlin.

sessions.name: Foldables for the rest of us
How Android Automotive Helps Us to Design and Build In-Car User Experiences

bio:
Titouan is a Senior Android Engineer at Innovorder, working remotly from Lyon. 

He is  also passionate about theatre and languages, loves riding his bike and walking in the nature.

Lately I've been exploring a variety of subjects such as CI/CD, KMPP, Jetpack Compose and Compose for Desktop, Ktor, and responsible use of resources.

sessions.name: How we migrated the CI / CD of our Android app to GitHub Actions

bio: Tomáš is an Android Developer Relations Engineer working at Google. He's working on making app performance less intimidating. Before Google, Tomáš worked as an Android Developer. His problem solving passion always was Dagger and modularization.

sessions.name: Deep dive into Modern Android Performance
Inspect and improve app performance

bio: Love Design, Engineering and solving complex problems with elegant solutions.

sessions.name: Comedy Talk - Better Android Development (BAD)

bio: Vinny is a developer relations engineer for Android. His focus areas are Android power and thermals, where he helps developers build power-efficient applications that run cool. Before joining Google, Vinny had similar roles at Lenovo, Samsung, and Vuforia working on both software development kits and hardware products in the augmented and virtual reality space. Earlier in his career, Vinny worked as a software engineer in the life sciences industry.

sessions.name: Is my application taking up too much power?

bio: Principal engineer @BMW for 3D rendering for the last few generations of infotainment systems. Primary maintainer of the Ramses libraries. Automation enthusiast and passionate about free and open source projects.

sessions.name: RAMSES - An Open Source 3D Graphics Tool Chain for Android

bio: Wojtek's focus is on helping developers build great apps using Android Studio and Kotlin, as well as teaching about new Framework and Play features. He enjoys looking for ways to make apps more usable, mostly through better development patterns and code optimizations.

sessions.name: Keynote: Now in Modern Android

bio: Xavier F. Gouchet is a Senior Software Engineer at Datadog, experienced public speaker, and proud father. Passionate about open source, testing and architecture, he has been dabbling in Android since the Cupcake days and has been working as a professional Android engineer since 2012.

sessions.name: Successfully publishing a tested, upgradeable and documented Open Source Library

bio:
Yacine is working as an Android Developer Advocate at Google, helping to make Android the best mobile platform for developers.
His focus is the developer experience across the whole ecosystem, from the expert to the beginner. He worked previously at IBM
as a developer advocate and as full stack developer in several startups. He's currently living in London, UK.

sessions.name: Live Coding Session: How do you Build More Privacy Focused Apps?

bio:
Android developer from almost the first days of Framework. participated in the GDE program for 3 years.
Vast experience in building mobile products in scale - from ride-sharing app Gett to leading Mobile team in monday.com - fast hyper-growing startup.
Founder of Android Academy, non-profit largest community of Android developers across 4 countries
Spoke in various Droidcons and DevFests.

medium: https://medium.com/@yonatanvlevin
previous talks: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FzmDFscF41o

sessions.name: 640K ought to be enough for anyone.

bio: Itinerant developer. SWE at Google. past: Eng at @facebook, @twitter. he/him.

sessions.name: It’s Time to Build for Wear OS

bio: With over 10 years of experience in Android development Zachary is now the Sr Android Developer Advocate at Vonage
tagLine: Sr Android Developer Advocate at Vonage

sessions.name: Using Communication APIs to enhance your UX (and reduce notifications!)

bio:
Zan is a senior developer advocate at CircleCI, on a mission to educate and inspire developers on the topics of CI/CD, DevOps, and software quality. 
Across his career he has worked in companies of various sizes, from enterprises to own startups, and everything in between, and across industries as diverse as retail, AI, and developer tools.
He’s passionate about serverless technologies, mobile development, and developer experience. Outside of work, he enthuses over airplanes, craft beer, and the Oxford comma.

sessions.name: A recipe for a CI/CD pipeline

bio:
Zhenlei is an Android engineer at N26 developing the first mobile bank app in Europe. He was previously part of the team at Venturus in Brazil, where he also got the chance to work with various partners (Sony Mobile, Motorola, etc) on their Android projects.

He has not only been developing for Android since Gingerbread but he also contributed to the AOSP (Android Open Source Project) in the Android Framework UI/UX team. He also has experience with test automation.

Besides that, he is an origami enthusiast that tries to fold a piece of paper in his spare time.
tagLine: Android Engineer • Script Addicted • Origami Enthusiast

sessions.name: Life is too short to develop only for Android - A journey to Server-driven UI
